title: Crispy Roasted Chicken Recipe
description: This roasted half chicken is prepared Bavarian-style with spices and herbs, including caraway, sage, fennel, garlic, rosemary, coriander, and paprika.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines European German Crispy Roasted Chicken 4.7 (134) 107 Reviews 19 Photos This roasted half chicken is inspired by Brathähnchen, commonly served in Bavarian biergartens, small shops, and food carts. You can serve this oven-roasted chicken with many side dishes, but favorites include fried potatoes or spaetzle and a nice garden salad. Weiss beer doesn't hurt at all! Submitted by Doc Simonson Updated on January 30, 2023 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 19 19 19 19 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 1 hr Additional Time: 10 mins Total Time: 1 hr 30 mins Servings: 6 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 1 teaspoon kosher salt ½ teaspoon caraway seeds ½ teaspoon dried sage ¼ teaspoon fennel seeds ¼ teaspoon coriander seeds ¼ teaspoon dried rosemary 2 tablespoons paprika 2 teaspoons garlic powder 2 teaspoons all-purpose flour 1 teaspoon onion powder 5 tablespoons vegetable oil 1 (4 pound) broiler-fryer chicken, cut in half lengthwise Directions Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Combine kosher salt, caraway, sage, fennel, coriander, and rosemary in a spice grinder or mortar. Grind to a coarse powder. Transfer spice mixture to a bowl; stir in paprika, garlic powder, flour, and onion powder. Mix in vegetable oil to make a smooth paste. Pat chicken halves dry with paper towels and tuck wing tips behind the back. Brush spice paste onto chicken halves, coating all sides and seasoning under wings and legs. Place chicken halves, skin-sides up, in a baking dish or roasting pan, leaving space around chickens so halves aren't touching. Roast in the preheated oven until no longer pink at the bone and the juices run clear, about 1 hour. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the thigh, near the bone, should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Remove from the oven and let rest for 10 minutes before slicing. I Made It Print 226 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Crispy Roasted Chicken 01 of 19 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 19 Photo by  Teresa Holden 07/13/2020 I made this using my Ronco “Set it and forget it” rotisserie cooker. I dry brined it with the seasonings (minus the oil) for approx. 4 hours. It came out amaaaazing! Thank you so much for this delicious recipe! 03 of 19 Photo by  Dan 04/05/2020 04 of 19 Photo by  Helen Ivanenko 04/01/2020 OMG, this was so good! I roasted the whole 4lb chicken using this recipe and cooked for 2 hrs at 350F. Definitely making this again and again 05 of 19 Photo by  Barb Sprague 11/07/2019 great recipe. followed the instructions and baked it in a cast iron skillet in the oven. tasty & a keeper! 06 of 19 Photo by  Kevin Houghton 09/30/2019 07 of 19 Photo by  Kevin Houghton 09/30/2019 08 of 19 Photo by  Mike g 09/28/2019 09 of 19 Photo by  JULIAGULIA3 01/01/2019 Easy, flavorful, juicy, and delicious. My family loves this recipe. Highly, highly recommend. 10 of 19 Photo by  Kit-e-kat 03/11/2017 Fabulous! This tasted just like the roasted chicken in Bavarian Bier halls! 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Sicilian Roasted Chicken 245 Ratings Roast Chicken with Rosemary 845 Ratings Caribbean-Spiced Roast Chicken 258 Ratings Roast Sticky Chicken-Rotisserie Style 4,546 Ratings The Best Roasted Chicken 29 Ratings Simple Lemon-Baked Chicken 147 Ratings Marinated Rosemary Chicken 26 Ratings Lemon-Roasted Chicken 92 Ratings Petite Blanquette de Poulet a l'Estragon (Tarragon Chicken) 12 Ratings Spicy Rapid Roast Chicken 887 Ratings Paprika Chicken 28 Ratings Broiled Paprika and Lemon-Pepper Chicken Breasts 19 Ratings Cottage Cheese Spinach Chicken 149 Ratings Cinnamon-Rubbed Chicken 8 Ratings Roasted Lemon Balm Chicken 10 Ratings Beer Butt Chicken 937 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Doc Simonson
instructions: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).;Combine kosher salt, caraway, sage, fennel, coriander, and rosemary in a spice grinder or mortar. Grind to a coarse powder. Transfer spice mixture to a bowl; stir in paprika, garlic powder, flour, and onion powder. Mix in vegetable oil to make a smooth paste.;Pat chicken halves dry with paper towels and tuck wing tips behind the back. Brush spice paste onto chicken halves, coating all sides and seasoning under wings and legs. Place chicken halves, skin-sides up, in a baking dish or roasting pan, leaving space around chickens so halves aren't touching.;Roast in the preheated oven until no longer pink at the bone and the juices run clear, about 1 hour. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the thigh, near the bone, should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Remove from the oven and let rest for 10 minutes before slicing.
